WorkItem.Description: When using the attached character and trying to use the Optimizer the Optimizer will crash and i need to kill Rawr via Task-Manager

Comments.Message:
We need some more information, crash can mean a lot of things.
1) Does it reach a point and just sit there for a bit? Have you tried waiting longer (in case it's just needing to make an intense calculation)?
2) Do you get any error messages?
3) Do you have a log in your Rawr folder in the form of a text file named DEBUGME or something?

Sorry for the very few informations.
By crash i mean: 
When i start the process (with maximum thoroughness) the label in the bottom left corner states: "-1E+07" instead of a percent value, the taskbar icon states 0% for a very long time and the hole system barely reacts and even the taskmanager only reacts very slowly (this shouldn't be a hardware issue with my system, because usually when i use the optimizer i can still fully utilize my system) 
When i put the "Thoroughness" skale at the minimum the finishes very quickly without an error.
When i put it just a little further right it first states "-1E+07" as the percentage value but after a short time there is a real percentage value, but still it stops at some point or becomes very slow (didn't let i run for more than ~3 minutes).
Before this update the process took with maximum thoroughness about ~3-5 minutes

So no i don't get any error since the process doesn't terminate and no errorlog
For me seems to only happen when DbW and another ArP trinket is available when optimizing.
Hm, I'll look in to this
This isn't a crash, at least on my system.  It's just running slowly.  I got it all the way through to 100%
i have the same problem, the optimizer is very very slow and the cpu usage ist still 99%. With an Intel Core2Duo@2x 3000 MhZ!
Edit: if i swtich to "Simulated Annealing" it works with normal speed

The problem only occurs sometimes, or for some characters.  It occurred only when you have 2 arp effects and try to get your arp uptimes without a weapon equipped, which the optimizer sometimes will consider.  Simulated Annealing should be used as a temporary workaround until the next release.  Checkin #44637 fixed this problem.

To clarify some points: it isn't a crash, it just takes a while to process.  No weapon equipped led to a trigger interval of Infinity for your arp procs due to a bug, so the Arp uptime calculation freaked out and did 20 iterations rather than ~2-4.  You can still cancel, and it will eventually stop, although if you're not worried about losing unsaved changes, you can just kill the process to speed it along.
